flawed_nl_solution:
On the third day, there were one-third of the number of bedbugs as the fourth day, so there were 810 / 3 = <<810/3=720>>720 bedbugs.
On the second day, there were one-third of the third day's bedbugs, so there were 720 / 3 = <<720/3=240>>240 bedbugs.
On the first day, there were 240 / 3 = <<240/3=80>>80 bedbugs in the group to start with.
#### 80

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 270, not 720. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
